title: Executive Outlook of the Global Medium- and Heavy-Duty Low-Cost Truck Market
text:
ReportBuyer
LONDON , Sept. 15, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- Executive Outlook of the Global Medium- and Heavy-Duty Low-Cost Truck Market : By 2022, Low-Cost Truck Sales will Reach 1.3 Million Units
The TRIAD is expected to experience increasing demand for low-cost trucks due to the struggling economy. Proliferation of low-cost Chinese and Indian brands is likely in these markets in the medium-duty truck segment. Higher penetration of low-cost brands from China and India is likely in Next 11, Africa , and South America due to similar market conditions and customer preferences. Rising affluence in China and India is expected to increase demand for better-quality trucks rather than low-cost trucks.
Key Research Takeaways
The economic slowdown is likely to push developed nations to consider low-cost alternatives, which offers Chinese and Indian truck manufacturers in the region opportunities for penetration and growth.
Low-Cost Truck Market, Global, 2014–2022
Global* low-cost truck market to grow at CAGR % to over million units by 2022
The market is driven by increasing demand in South America , Africa , North America , Western Europe , and Next countries, counteracting stable and declining demand in India and China , respectively.
Increasing demand for low-cost trucks in North America and Western Europe largely due to economic conditions
Prolonged economic slowdown and structural changes to freight movement patterns have changed truck purchase patterns. Low-cost truck sales are expected to grow at CAGRs of % and % in North America and Western Europe , respectively, from 2014 to 2022.
